intro: Cochlearia officinalis subsp. anglica, commonly known as the English cochlearia, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features basal rosettes of pinnately lobed leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. It is native to coastal areas of Europe and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. The species is often found in maritime environments, where it thrives in saline and well-drained conditions.
